news-item.title: Danone rises 0.7% from 14-day low
news-item.source: Global Round Up - ADRs and Depository Receipts
news-item.text: ADRS AND DEPOSITORY RECEIPTS Sponsored Danone (OT:DANOY) was up 0.7% from its 14-day low of US$13.66 on 14 March, 2014. Its Williams % R is -81.8. A reading of between -80 and -100 suggests it is near its 14-day low. This is defined as oversold, a bullish signal. The ADR price increased 3.0c (or 0.2%) to close at US$13.76, ending a three-day streak of losses. Compared with the Bank of New York Mellon Composite ADR Index which fell 0.3 points (or 0.2%) in the day, this represented a relative price increase of 0.4%. Bullish SignalsOversold/Bullish/Support Signals- The ADR is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -81.8, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of US$13.66. NoteBeta: the Beta of Danone ADR is 0.4. A Beta lower than 1 suggests this is a low risk, low return ADR with volatility less than that of the market. - Danone is at a discount of 14.6% to its 12-month high of US$16.12 on 02 Aug, 2013. It is also at a premium of 5.0% to the 12-month low of US$13.11 on 31 Jan, 2014. - The present value of US$1,000 (PV$1000) invested one year ago in Danone is US$945, for a capital loss of US$55. Bearish Signals:- The price decreased 0.6% in the last month. The ADR has been exacerbated by firm volume of 1.6 times average for the month. - In the last three months the ADR has hit a new 52-week low once. Using the current exchange rate of EUR1 equals 1.39 USD, the shares are at a 0.2% premium to the close price in the US Market. Aggregate volume: there were 1,917,468 shares worth USD115,772,844 traded. The aggregate volume was 0.77 times average trading of 2,488,488 shares. Additional tests revealed later on that it was in fact a false alert.This affair illustrates serious failings on Fonterra's part in applying the quality standards required in the food industry.Danone is terminating its existing supply contract with Fonterra and making any further collaboration contingent on a commitment by its supplier to full transparency and compliance with the cutting-edge food safety procedures applied to all products supplied to Danone.Danone is also initiating proceedings in the New Zealand High Court, as well as arbitration proceedings in Singapore to bring all facts to light and to obtain compensation for the harm it has suffered.As a leading food company, Danone makes food safety an absolute priority and is committed to working only with suppliers that share and respect the same demanding professional standards.Source: NYSE Euronext ISIN: US23636T1007 Source: www.BuySellSignals.com
